intro: Zornia diphylla var. latifolia, commonly known as broadleaf zornia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive two-lobed leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
